description:
This funky and chirpy little handknit Party on Your Head hat is the perfect newborn photography prop for a baby girl and makes a great gift for a new mommy. This original newborn photography prop design is on the cover of my best-selling book of original knitting patterns for infant and toddler photo props, “Welcoming Home Baby the Handcrafted Way” (© Tricia Drake, March, 2011). This chunky little hat makes an unforgettable shower gift, festive holiday or Christmas present, and is absolutely perfect as a unique newborn (and older baby!) photography prop. 

Knit your own TrickyKnits original Party on Your Head Hat in the Kiss Me Scarlett colorway of rich winter white with a scarlet red ruffle - perfect for a photo shoot for your newborn's first Christmas, and makes the perfect Christmas card photo prop. This knitting kit includes all of the yarns you need to knit your own Party On Your Head Hat in the largest size in the book (6-12 month, which fits up to at least 20 months).

All kits are packaged in a very handy organza drawstring bag and includes the yarns you need to knit the It does NOT include the pattern or needles. All yarns are merino wool, deliciously soft for everyday use, with just enough texture to let people know you're not knitting the average baby gift. Makes a great gift for a knitter!

Copyrighted pattern - patterns from my book may NOT be knit for re-sale, but they do make absolutely unforgettable gifts. 

You'll also need:
* My book, which has the pattern. Click here to purchase a signed copy of "Welcoming Home Baby the Handcrafted Way": http://www.etsy.com/listing/69073935/knitting-patterns-for-newborn

Save 10% off your needle purchase when paired with a kit!

Other colorways available - Morning Glories (turquoise and lime), Birthday Cake (ivory and pink), Tropical Punch (orange and green), Kiss Me Scarlett (ivory and red), Watermelon (pinks and more pinks!) as well as Berries (magenta and hot pink - not yet pictured). Please contact me, or indicate your choice of color in the "Notes to Seller" box at Checkout. If no color is indicated, I will assume the Kiss Me Scarlett colorway.

Here's a testimonial from Amy in WA..." I have to tell you that EVERY time I take my baby out in this hat she gets tons of compliments! We went shopping a few days before Christmas, when it was so busy, and I got stopped by so many people who loved her hat!"

name: Mini Blanket Newborn Photography Prop Handspun Wrap for Baby Girl "rose garden" pinks and greens by
description:
*** TrickyKnits Newborn Photo Prop Baby Girl Hat and Mini Blanket Set Throw Handspun Wrap for Baby Girl Perfect for First Photo Shoot Tricky Knits***

The TrickyKnits Baby's Breath Handspun Blanket Hammock/Wrap is the perfect newborn photography prop for newborn photographers looking for luxurious texture, color, and versatility in their handknit props. Available with coordinating hats in a variety of styles, shown here with the Chandra Hat (see below for the link). Use this handknit newborn photography prop as a hammock (thanks, Andrea Hallett from 2009!), a mini-throw to line a bowl or basket, a cocoon, a pod, or a stunning wrap - perfect for twins, too! This generous size newborn photography wrap is handknit for you using only the highest quality hand-dyed and handspun yarns. I design the colors and proportions of the fibers of my line of handspun yarns, then hours go into dyeing and spinning each skein of the yarn used in this piece. Your props, like your photography equipment, are a reflection of your quality standards. They are an investment that you will give you years of use with proper care. For years this piece has only been available through TrickyKnits as a custom order - now available in your choice of 20 colorways. Contact me for photos and we'll design your signature piece. 

If you're looking for the coordinating hat - that's my Chandra Hat, available here: http://www.etsy.com/listing/63013710/baby-girl-hat-newborn-photography-prop

This listing is for the "rose garden" colorway in the first listing pic. Some of the other colorways are shown, and many more available.

This piece is a generous rectangle, not a skimpy square - newborn photographers will find multiple uses for this handspun piece, as you can see from the photos!

NOTE: The TrickyKnits original Baby's Breath Handspun Hammock is handknit when you place your order. PLEASE ALLOW 10-12 DAYS for your item to be created for you.

Thank you to the fantastic Amy Columbus, Brooke Kelly, and Andrea Hallett for the beautiful photos!

Just in time for Halloween babies, a new original handknit photography prop knitting pattern for your October newborn photo shoots, or your own brand new little Halloween spook! name: Knitting Pattern for Baby Photo Prop Wrap Swaddler Wrap Cocoon by TrickyKnits - Sell What You Make -
description:
Knitting Pattern for Photography Prop Baby Wrap Newborn Photo Prop Infant Boy Mohair Lace Blanket Sell What You Make

Knit your own newborn photography prop! The TrickyKnits Baby's Breath Mohair Lace Blanket is an easy pattern for even the newest knitters. Shown in a soothing shade of Robin's Egg blue out of the most delicate imported mohair blend, it is perfect for newborn photo shoots and delightfully warm and soft on your new baby's sensitive skin.

The TrickyKnits Baby's Breath Mohair Lace Wrap is a very versatile piece. The wispy, texture-rich design and sumptuous color makes a picture-perfect prop for tender newborn photography. The stretchy handknit fabric will conform to just about any need - use it as a cocoon to swaddle your sweet subject, or use it as a pod/womb - perfect for twins, too! You can lay your tiny angel on top of it, or let it gently float across their bare backside. Makes a great mini-blanket or throw to line your favorite trench bowl or baby bed. You'll find so many uses for it. 

You can sell what you make with this TrickyKnits pattern! Needless to say, you may not sell the pattern yourself - you only need to mention in the listing for your handmade item that the pattern is a TrickyKnits original from TrickyKnits.com.

This TrickyKnits original pattern will be e-mailed to you as a pdf by the NEXT BUSINESS DAY.  I try not to work weekends so that I may spend time with my family, so please DO NOT EXPECT pattern shipments over weekends or holidays.  If you want a hard copy, please mention that in the "Notes to Seller" box at checkout.

You TrickyKnitters out there already know I always knit it chunky, so my designs are meant to fly off your needles!  This stitch takes a little more experience than a total beginner might be up for, but I'm here to help and can send you links to tutorials.  

You can e-mail me at tric@trickyknits.com, or find me on Facebook as TrickyKnits.

Knit it chunky!

Thanks so much to the wonderful Mary Warren and Sandi Hicks for the great photos! You can visit their sites at marywarrenphotography.co.uk/blog sandihicksphotography.com.

name: Knitting Patterns for Newborn Photo Props Hats, Blankets, Cocoons Signed Copy Welcoming Home Baby th
description:
TrickyKnits Custom Handknit Newborn Photography Props book of 20 original knitting patterns was released in March 2011! "Welcoming Home Baby the Handcrafted Way" is the first book of knitting patterns to include designs for newborn photography props, and includes several original TrickyKnits best-selling designs. TrickyKnits is one of the longest-established and successful designers of handknit newborn photography props whose creative and innovative styles have inspired a wave of photographers and knitters alike.  Winner of the Benjamin Franklin Award for 2012, and a finalist for ForeWord Magazine's Book of the Year.  Over 22,500 copies in print as of December 2012.

NOTE: You may not sell finished projects from this book - any unlicensed use of copyrighted material for commercial use is illegal. All material contained in this book, including the written instructions, photographs, designs, patterns, and projects, are intended for the personal use of the reader. Any other use, especially commercial use of the finished designs or patterns, or derivatives of those designs and patterns, for personal gain is forbidden under law without the express written permission of the copyright holder. The exclusive right to sell the finished designs, as well as the patterns, in whole or in part, resides solely with the author.

November 2, 2011 - Back at press for a second reprint in just 6 months! That makes 18,500 copies in print worldwide. Knit it chunky! ;)

June 2011 - NEW - My designs are currently featured in the Summer 2011 issue of Living Crafts magazine, as well as the summer issue of Spool Magazine. 

June 201 - NEW feature - KnitSimple Magazine (sister publication of Vogue Knitting)

5/31 NEW REVIEW from Yarn Market News: "As the mother of seven young children, it's a wonder author Drake has any time to knit at all, much less run a successful hand-knitting accessories business...her juxtaposition of wee babe and bulky yarns is unexpected - and it works wonderfully!"

5/15/11 First printing of 7,500 sold out - back to press this week!

4/29/11 NEW REVIEW from KnitchMagazine.com: "Cuteness overload! Ruffly hats, with names like Twisted Taffy, Party on Your Head and Chinny Chin Chinstrap, will give any baby a totally unique look that enhances his or her own adorability quotient. Knit with novelty touches and soft, bulky yarns, these hats work up fast and are far from the delicately edged baby hats of the past. "

4/29/11 NEW REVIEW from ForeWord Magazine: "The two biggest obstacles for novice knitters are the need to learn how to read knitting instructions and the length of time it can take to complete even a small project. Tricia Drake has tackled both problems in this joyously colorful book of knitted items for newborns...The greatest innovation Drake makes in designs for babies is using thick, bulky yarns on large knitting needles...Drake's writing style is breezy and familiar, like a best friend demonstrating a knitting stitch..."

3/16/11 REVIEW from Living Crafts Magazine, Spring 2011: “Some of the designs in this book are so unique and so perfect for a new baby that they seem commissioned by Mother Nature herself…”

3/14/11 REVIEW from Publishers Weekly: …“Drake, founder of TrickyKnits, captures a festive mood in this collection of hand knit baby gifts. description:

If you prefer the multi-yarn drawstring, please indicate in the "Notes to Seller" box at Checkout and I will invoice you separately for the balance.

This is a TrickyKnits original design celebrating 3 years in January 2011. I created this piece in late 2008 after hearing numerous complaints from pro photographers that their nifty new Etsy handknit infant pod props they had purchased were stretching out after one use (or didn't have enough body to stay put in the first place), I set out to find a simple solution. The Peek-a-Boo Drawstring Snuggler/Pod features an invisible drawstring tucked under the playful handspun border, allowing you complete control over how much, or how little, of your tiny subject you want to see. No more floppy brims that don't do their job! No more fiddling around with a handknit piece that has no body to it and won't hold its shape! Who has time for fiddling with prop problems during a newborn shoot? 

For even more versatility, the Peek-a-Boo Drawstring Snuggler/Pod comes with two 1/2"-wide satin ribbons in the colors of your choice. Add a pop of color that suits your needs and wrap up your little angel like a wonderful present. Choose from a variety of popular parent-pleasing color combinations: chocolate, hot pink, turquoise, spring green, ivory, baby blue, and soft pink.

Handknit in a soft wool blend and accented with a matching texture-rich tufted border. Will fit newborn up to 10 pounds. Twin size also available. Shown in ivory with an ivory border, but custom yarn combinations available on a limited basis - contact me and we'll design your signature piece!

name: Baby Girl Cocoon Photography Prop Custom Photo Shoot Peacock Ruffled Fanback Lace-Up Newborn Infant
description:
The TrickyKnits Proud-as-a-Peacock Fanback Lace-up Cocoon is an original design that made it's debut in February 2009 - now available in Watermelon. This handknit cocoon is perfect for professional newborn photographers who are looking for high-end, ultra-luxurious custom props with more versatility and big texture in their handknit pieces. This TrickyKnits design is the original cocoon to feature a generous ruffled fanback collar that can be spread flat as a colorful backdrop to frame a newborn's sweet face, or gathered to create a scrumptious ruffle to cradle your tiny subject. Draped over a basket as a mini-blanket, it makes a stunning and very comfy little throw. 

This sweet and girlish piece is knit in a deliciously soft Italian merino blend in the yummiest shade of hot pink with my own line of chunky handspun accent yarn around the collar in swirly girly shades of spring green, hot pink, bubble gum pink, and a hint of silvery sparkle. The TrickyKnits original invisible drawstring design around the top of the cocoon allows you complete control over how tight or loosely you want this piece to fit. Lace-up corset design allows you to control how much or how little of your tiny subject you want to see. Drawstring opening at the piggies allow them to poke through if you like. 

The sumptuous color and rich texture of this piece make it a picture-perfect prop for tender newborn photography. The loosely handknit fabric has plenty of stretch.

Note: The TrickyKnits original Proud-as-a-Peacock Ruffled Fanback Cocoon is handknit you after you place your order. Due to popular demand, PLEASE ALLOW UP TO 3 WEEKS for your custom newborn photography prop to be handknit. Rush orders are available on a limited basis - please contact me to discuss.

This style is available in countless colorways, including boy and neutral designs. Contact me by clicking on the Contact TrickyKnits link or send me an email to tric [!at] trickyknits.com and we'll design your signature piece.

Thank you, Amy Columbus and Brooke Kelly for the great product shots.

description:

This TrickyKnits original design hanging baby bunting/cocoon/sling is handknit for your tiny subject using a beautifully textured merino in the softest shade of baby pink paired with a summery and flirty little yarn with hints of purple, hot pink, and ivory. This piece is soft enough for baby's tender skin, but plenty strong enough to support at least up to 15 pounds. The open stitchwork will allow tiny piggies to poke through. 

Also available in chocolate, light blue, dark blue, ivory, and countless custom colorways including other neutrals, as well as "boy" and "girl". 

Note: this is meant as a prop only to be used under supervision by a professional photographer. Never leave baby unattended in a hanging prop!

name: ORIGINAL DESIGNER Peek-a-Boo Pod in Strawberry Sundae Handspun - Drawstring Snuggler Egg Cocoon for
description:
This item is handknit when you place your order and is currently taking 3 weeks to get to you. Due to slight variations in the handspun yarn used as the border, yours may not look exactly like the one above, but it will be equally beautiful! Thank you to talented Amy Columbus for the wonderful photos - http://www.amycolumbusphotography.com/

Finally! A practical design for photographers looking for a handknit newborn snuggler/pod/egg prop. After hearing numerous complaints from pro photographers that their nifty new Etsy handknit infant pod props they had purchased were stretching out after one use (or wouldn't stay put in the first place), I set out to find a simple solution. The Peek-a-Boo Drawstring Snuggler/Pod features an invisible drawstring tucked under the playful handspun border, allowing you complete control over how much, or how little, of your tiny subject you want to see. No more floppy brims that don't do their job! No more fiddling around with a handknit piece that has no body to it and won't hold its shape! Who has time for fiddling with prop problems during a newborn shoot?

For even more versatility, the Peek-a-Boo Drawstring Snuggler/Pod comes with your choice of a 1/2"-wide satin ribbon in pink, or a matching handspun drawstring (shown). Add a pop of color that suits your needs and wrap up your little angel like a wonderful present. 

Handknit in a soft wool blend and accented with a coordinating texture-rich handspun wool/mohair border. Will fit newborn up to 10 pounds. Twin size also available. Shown in pink, but custom yarn combinations available - convo me and we'll design your signature piece.
